Entries.default: The ring continues its lethargic rotation around the pylon. Up close, it emanates a faint hum.
You find a small machine sitting on a dais, surrounded by a spinning ring. It appears to be of Engwithan origin.
You shut down the machine. The floating ring grinds to a halt, and the energy it emits winks out of existence.
You note the speed of the ring's rotation and the subtle pattern of the machine's humming. After a bit of prodding, the pylon's workings make sense to you.
No matter how you poke and prod at the machine, its purpose eludes you.
You smash the control panel a few times until the sensitive machinery buckles and breaks. A moment later, the ring around the machine stops spinning. The energy it emits winks out of existence.
Try as you might, the pylon proves impervious to your attacks.
The entire structure shakes so violently it nearly knocks you to your knees. The barrier flickers, then disappears with a pop.
The rumbling is louder this time, and the barrier opposite you flashes and wavers. Cracks race up the walls, followed by many more leaks.
A low rumbling echoes through the ruins, and the barrier on the window nearest you flickers briefly. Small trickles of water begin to flow nearby.
